data.event: From Statistics and Gazetteer of New-Hampshire, 1875: "Chester is considered one of the old towns of the state.

event.title: 1719, about eighty persons, chiefly from Portsmouth and Hampton, formed

data.event: In 1719, about eighty persons, chiefly from Portsmouth and Hampton, formed an association, for the purpose of securing a tract of land in the "Chesnut Country" (so called) and stationed three men upon this tract, to hold possession until they should procure a lawful title.

event.title: 8th of May, 1722 the township which had hitherto been called Cheshire, was incorporated

data.event: On the 8th of May, 1722 the township which had hitherto been called Cheshire, was incorporated under its present name, and comprising an area of over 120 square miles [310 km2]."
